content:
• Wednesday, September 24, 2014
  • MHRCQ

    Magnum Hunter hits Utica gas gusher, shares +7% AH

    • Magnum Hunter (MHR) +6.8%Â AH after announcing record production results for its latest well in West Virginia's Utica shale, bringing on the Stewart Winland 1300U last weekend at peak rate of 46.5M cf/day of gas, or ~7,750 boe/day.
    • MHR says the new discovery represents the greatest flow rate and one of the highest sustained flowing casing pressures of any Utica well drilled in the entire play of Ohio and West Virginia, and is one of the highest flow rate gas wells ever reported in any shale play in the U.S.
    • Also, three new Marcellus Shale wells, which are also 100% owned by the company, have been fracture stimulated and are ready for sales.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:56 PM | 3 Comments
  • RNN

    Rexahn +7.9% AH after RX-3117 receives orphan status

    • The FDA has granted orphan status to Rexahn's (NYSEMKT:RNN) RX-3117 pancreatic cancer drug. Patients are being enrolled in a Phase 1b clinical trial that's expected to be completed during Q1 2015.
    • Rexahn notes pre-clinical studies have shown RX-3117 "maintains its anti-tumor activity in human cancer cell lines" that are resistant to widely-used chemotherapy drug gemcitabine. Up to 40% of pancreatic cancer patients treated with gemcitabine have become resistant to the drug after 30 days.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:55 PM | 7 Comments

  • After Hour Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: MM +5.9%. JBL +4.1%. CYBR +3.9%. ECYT +3.6%. HTCH +2.9%.
    • Top losers, as of 5:15 p.m.: SHOR -6.6%. SNMX -5.8%. BNFT -4.3%. UEPS -4.1%. BTX -3.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM
  • XGTI

    xG Technology +4.7% AH on financing deal

    • Lincoln Park Capital Fund has agreed to buy up to $16M worth of xG Technology (NASDAQ:XGTI) shares.
    • xG sold $1M worth of shares to LPC at $2/share on Monday. A stock purchase agreement allows for the sale of up to $15M more over the next 24 months.
    • xG will "control the timing and amount of any sales to LPC." LPC is "obligated to make purchases, if and when xG directs." Purchase prices will be based on "prevailing market prices." xG has issued shares to LPC as a "commitment fee" for the deal.
    • xG had $5M in cash at the end of Q2, and $2M in convertible notes payable. With the company's market cap currently at $48M, LPC stands to become a major shareholder.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:51 PM
  • JBL

    Jabil +4.1% AH on FQ4 beat, strong FQ1 guidance

    • Jabil (NYSE:JBL) expects FQ1 revenue of $4.2B-$4.4B and EPS of $0.41-$0.53, mostly above a consensus of $4.11B and $0.41. However, FY15 (ends Aug. '15) guidance of $1.65-$1.95 is reiterated; consensus is at $1.74.
    • Diversified manufacturing revenue rose $300M Y/Y to $2.1B; enterprise & infrastructure was $1.4B; high-velocity systems (still affected by the loss of BlackBerry sales) fell $400M to $900M.
    • Gross margin fell 40 bps Y/Y to 6.5%. SG&A spend rose 3% to $177.9M.
    • FQ4 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM
  • JBL

    Jabil Circuit beats by $0.05, beats on revenue

    • Jabil Circuit (NYSE:JBL): FQ4 EPS of $0.05 beats by $0.05.
    • Revenue of $4.1B (-14.8% Y/Y) beats by $270M.
    • Shares +7.87% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM
  • ECTE

    Two Echo board members negotiate funding deal to keep company afloat

    • Two newly-elected Echo Therapeutics (OTC:ECTE -32.7%) board members negotiate a funding agreement with Platinum Management for $3M over 30 weeks. The two directors, Michael Goldberg, M.D. and Shepard M. Goldberg, will have sole control over the funds, aÂ crystal-clear signal that the services of the three "lingering" board members are no longer required.
    • In addition, the capital will not convert into Echo shares until the three are removed. Platinum has agreed to reduce its voting power by transitioning 91% of its common stock holdings into preferred stock. It has also agreed to keep its ownership stake below 20% for voting purposes until after the 2016 annual meeting.
    • The funding is set to begin on Monday, September 29, 2014.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM | 2 Comments
  • TIBX

    Tibco flies higher on reported P-E interest

    • Private equity firms Vista and Thoma Bravo are reportedly vying to buy Tibco Software (TIBX +7.6%)
    • Previously: Tibco +6% AH; strategic review officially launched
     
     
     
     
    | 3:37 PM
  • ELMD

    Investors like Electromed's Q4 results

    • Thinly-traded nano cap Electromed (ELMD +24.5%) pops on a 20x surge in volume albeit on turnover of only 400K shares. The company reported Q4 and FY results yesterday after the close.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM
  • EGLT

    Egalet drops after disclosure on abuse deterrent morphine product candidate

    • Thinly-traded nano cap Egalet Corp. (OTC:EGLT -27.2%) plummets on a 3x surge in volume albeit on turnover of only 99K shares. At the close yesterday, the company reported that it will need to conduct additional clinical trials for Egalet-001, its abuse deterrent extended release oral morphine product candidate. In a crossover pharmacokinetic study, Egalet-001 failed its bioequivalence endpoint at the 90% CI (confidence interval).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:09 PM
  • VHC

    VirnetX +7.1% after announcing patent related to Gabriel

    • The USPTO has granted VirnetX (NYSEMKT:VHC) a patent related to the creation of an "encrypted communications channel" between two devices using secure domain names. (USPTO filing)
    • The patent is the tenth granted to VirnetX in 2014, and is tied to the company's Gabriel secure connection platform.
    • Shares have risen 27% from a Sep. 18 low of $4.18. They remain down 64% from where they closed the day before last week's Apple appeals court ruling.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM
  • ECTE

    Lack of money forces Echo Therapeutics to suspend operations

    • Citing insufficient liquidity, Echo Therapeutics (OTC:ECTE -29.2%) suspends its operations. The resumption of operations will be dependent on securing additional third party funding.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM
  • ATOS

    Atossa gets roughed up after FDA decision on breast aspirator

    • Thinly-traded nano cap Atossa Genetics (ATOS -42.3%) gets smacked down on a 10x surge in volume after the FDA says it will have to resubmit a 510(k) application for its ForeCYTE Breast Aspirator.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:54 PM
  • SFS

    Smart & Final +6.7% in IPO launch

    • Shares of Smart & Final (NYSE:SFS) rally 6.7% above their initial pricing of $12 per share in their IPO debut.
    • The grocery store chain raised close to $160M in the offering to value the company at just under $1B.
    • SEC Form S-1
     
     
     
     
    | 1:50 PM | 2 Comments
  • SWKS

    Skyworks, RF Micro, TriQuint gain following MKM launches

    • Predicting the companies will benefit from a "golden age" for RF components (echoes of recent analyst notes), MKM's Ian Ing has launched coverage on Skyworks (SWKS +2.9%) and RF Micro (RFMD +2.5%) with Buy ratings. His targets are respectively $68 and $15. TriQuint (TQNT +2.7%) is following RF Micro higher.
    • Ing expects Skyworks' Panasonic RF filter JV to provide both technology and gross margin benefits, and thinks the company can achieve $5/year in EPS earlier than expected; the FY15 (ends Sep. '15) EPS consensus is currently at $3.93.
    • Regarding RF Micro, he likes the company's post-merger revenue synergies with TriQuint, and also its Chinese 4G exposure. "The main risk we see is RFMD's ability to balance post-merger synergies with supply requirements in serving steep OEM ramps."
    • Skyworks is making new post-Dot.com bubble highs. RF Micro and TriQuint aren't far removed from post-bubble highs of $12.98 and $21.48.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM | 2 Comments

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Top 10 Gainers: LPCN +41%. CADC +23%. ACOR +22%. GDOT +21%. ELMD +21%. OBCI +21%. CBMX +19%. MTSL +16%. CREG +11%. UQM +10%.
    • Top 10 Losers: ATOS -42%. GTI -30%. OTC:ECTE -29%. OTC:EGLT -26%. CNET -19%. CJJD -13%. MAMS -13%. AIR -11%. WLT -10%. BIOC -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM | 1 Comment
  • GEVO

    Gevo patents rejected by USPTO, plans appeal

    • Gevo (GEVO -11.3%) plunges after the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office issued an inter partes review decision rejecting the claims of Gevo's U.S. patents which cover methods of isobutanol separation and recovery in retrofit ethanol plants.
    • Gevo says the decision affects only two of its nearly 500 patents and applications worldwide.
    • Gevo says it plans to appeal the decision to the U.S. Court of Appeals.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM
  • CBMX

    Traders jump on CombiMatrix

    • Traders push shares of nano cap CombiMatrix (CBMX +24.6%) up this morning on 2x higher volume on no news.
    • Coattailers might want to keep their powder dry for a while, though. The stock is still mired in the throes of a 10-year down trend. Prices peaked at a reverse split-adjusted $930 in late January 2004.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:30 PM
  • SUNEQ

    GE shoots down SunEdison rumor

    • A GE spokesperson has denied a rumor GE is in talks to buy SunEdison (SUNE +3%)
    • SunEdison has quickly given back most of the morning gains it saw thanks to the rumor.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM
  • TSLA

    SolarCity rallies following bullish Goldman, Roth notes

    • Down AH yesterday after announcing a $500M convertible offering, SolarCity (SCTY +5.3%) is now up sharply with the help of bullish notes from Goldman and Roth.
    • Goldman has reiterated a Conviction Buy and $96 target. It's pleased with the convertible offering, as well as the closing of the Silevo acquisition and the securing of $500M+ in financing from the NY state government for SolarCity/Silevo's planned 1GW+ module plant.
    • Ground was broken in Buffalo yesterday for the plant, which is expected to go live in early 2016. SolarCity promises to invest $5B at the site (inc. payroll and opex) over the next 10 years, and to create 3K jobs. The NY government has committed $750M - $350M for building the plant, and $400M for equipment.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:22 PM | 1 Comment
  • GECC

    Full Circle gains amid insider buys

    • Full Circle Capital (FULL +4%) Co-CEO and President Gregg Felton purchased 5.1K shares of company stock on Monday and another 11.2K yesterday. Board member Terence Flynn bought 2K shares yesterday, and another director, Mark Biderman added 4.4K shares to his stake on Monday.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM
  • AIR

    AAR plunges after FQ1 results miss expectations, cuts FY 2015 guidance

    • AARÂ Corp. (AIR -9.6%) shares sink nearly 10% after the aviation industry supplier missed expectations for FQ1 earnings and revenue and cut guidance for its recently started FY 2015.
    • AAR lowered its EPS estimate to $1.65-$1.75 on revenue of $2B-$2.05B, down from its previous estimate for $1.80-$1.90 EPS on revenue of $2.1B-$2.15B, saying previous guidance included assumptions on the number and mix of contracted Airlift positions, including certain awards that now seem unlikely to materialize.
    • Sales in AAR's aviation services business fell 7.6% Y/Y, with a 27% decline in sales to defense customers offsetting a 7% growth in sales to commercial customers; in technology products, lower sales of mobility products contributed to an overall 13% decline.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM
  • UBNT

    Ubiquiti gains on SunTrust launch

    • SunTrust has launched coverage on Ubiquiti (UBNT +2.1%) with a Buy and $45 target.
    • The launch comes two days after Wunderlich cut its estimates due to concerns about Russian sales weakness, albeit while reiterating a Buy.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM | 2 Comments
  • HCLP

    Hi-Crush Partners upgraded to Buy at Wunderlich following pullback

    • Hi-Crush Partners (HCLP +6.8%) is upgraded to Buy from Hold with a $66 price target at Wunderlich, citing predictable growth and solid fundamentals.
    • The recent pullback in oil prices that has impacted E&P stocks has also taken a toll on frac sand stocks, particularly HCLP; the firm says the group's fall is much greater than the drop in oil prices and the E&P index, but demand for Northern White Sand remains inelastic in the near term.
    • Wunderlich continues to prefer Emerge Energy (EMES +4.8%) to HCLP on a risk-adjusted basis, but it rates both stocks at Buy.
    • Not mentioned in the report, U.S. Silica (SLCA +3.5%) also is moving higher today.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM | 8 Comments
  • CYBR

    CyberArk soars following IPO

    • After pricing its 5.36M-share IPO at $16 (above a $13-$15 range), CyberArk (NASDAQ:CYBR) opened at $25.00 and is now at $23.36, up 46%. The Israeli cybersecurity software vendor is valued at $691M, or 10.4x 2013 sales.
    • CyberArk had 1H14 revenue of $38.7M (+33% Y/Y), and nearly breakeven earnings. The company claims over 1,500 clients, including over 35% of the Fortune 100.
    • Prospectus, IPO preview
     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM | 1 Comment
  • POST

    Food stocks put in some gains

    • Food stocks are topping market averages as investors shift to a more defensive stance.
    • The sector is also getting a look with grain, corn, meat, and rice prices moderating on improved global supplies.
    • On the move: Post Holdings (NYSE:POST) +2.0%, Dean Foods (NYSE:DF) +1.0%, Sanderson Farms (NASDAQ:SAFM) +1.7%, Diamond Foods (NASDAQ:DMND) +1.5%, Flower Foods (NYSE:FLO) +1.3%, Hain Celestial (NASDAQ:HAIN) +1.6%, General Mills (NYSE:GIS) +0.7%, ConAgra (NYSE:CAG) +1.1%, Kraft Foods (KRFT) +1.0%, Tyson Foods (NYSE:TSN) +1.5%, Seaboard (NYSEMKT:SEB) +2.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM
  • LPCN

    LPCN 1021 hits primary endpoint in Phase 3 trial

    • Lipocine's (LPCN +40.8%) oral testosterone replacement therapy candidate, LPCN 1021, achieves its primary efficacy endpoint in a Phase 3 clinical trial.
    • The FDA guidelines for primary efficacy success stipulate a minimum of 75% of trial subjects on active treatment achieve a serum testosterone concentration within the normal range of 300-1140 ng/dL and the lower bound of the 95% CI (confidence interval) must be greater than 65%.
    • In the Phase 3 study, 88% of LPCN 1021-treated patients achieved testosterone levels in the normal range with a lower bound CI of 82%.
    • LPCN 1021's safety profile was acceptable as well. Three percent of the subjects reported a serious adverse event, though none were drug-related. All drug-related adverse events were mild or moderate. The safety extension phase of the trial is ongoing.
    • One aspect of the value proposition of oral TRT therapy is the elimination of the risk of inadvertent testosterone transfer associated with transdermal gels (before the gel dries).
    • Related tickers: (LLY +0.6%)(ABBV +1.1%)(RPRX +8.1%)(AUXL -0.2%)(TEVA +0.4%)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM | 2 Comments

  • Crude oil pops after unexpected inventory draw

    • Crude inventories fell 4.3M barrels last week, according to the EIA, vs. expectations for a 400K barrel gain and the previous week's 3.7M barrel gain.
    • The news is enough for a $0.70 cent spike in the price of November crude, nowÂ up 0.4%Â on the session at $91.92.
    • USOÂ +0.4%
    • ETFs: USO, OIL, UCO, SCO, BNO, DTO, DBO, CRUD, USL, UWTI, DNO, DWTI, SZO, OLO, OLEM
     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM | 2 Comments

  • New homes sales surge to 6-year high; markets shrug

    • Bond prices are mostly snoozing through the August New Home Sales report showing sales of single-family homes surging 18% to a six-year high of 504K (seasonally adjusted annual rate). Expectations had been for a pace of 426K. The 504K print is 33% higher than August one year ago.
    • Also ignoring the volatile number and instead focusing on weak results from KB Home, the ITB isÂ lower by 0.8%.
    • The 10-year Treasury yield has actually dropped nearly two basis points since the print, now flat on the session at 2.53%. TLT flat.
    • ETFs: TBT, TLT, TMV, TBF, EDV, TMF, TTT, ZROZ, SBND, TLH, DLBS, VGLT, UBT, TLO, TENZ, LBND, TYBS, DLBL
     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM | 2 Comments
  • RVLT

    Revolution Lighting pops on CEO's purchases

    • Revolution Lighting (RVLT +5.5%) CEO Robert LaPenta discloses he recently bought 100K shares at prices between $1.65-$1.68.
    • Yesterday, Revolution made a fresh 52-week low of $1.63.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:00 AM
  • HIMX

    Himax rallies; BofA ups estimates, sees Google adding to stake

    • BofA/Merrill has hiked its Himax (HIMX +4.4%) estimates on expectations of stronger smart glass adoption. The firm also thinks Google will exercise its option to up its stake in Himax's LCoS microdisplay subsidiary to 14.8% from 6.3%.
    • BofA upgraded Himax to Buy from Underperform in August. Last week, Northland reported Google has concluded Samsung's OLED microdisplays aren't bright enough for Glass, and predicted the Web giant is likely to stick with Himax.
    • Shares are now up 74% from a July low of $5.70. However, they're still down 36% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM | 9 Comments
  • LAND

    Gladstone Land down 5.4% after secondary

    • The company priced its 1.15M share secondary offering at $12.28 each, and the underwriters have the option of buying another 172.5K shares at that price. Net proceeds to Gladstone (LAND -5.4%) are expected to be about $13.3M (exclusive of the greenshoe).
    • The offering boosted the float by about 17.6%. The opening decline puts the stock price at $12.10.
    • Previously: Gladstone Land pulls $4.3M in cash from farms
     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM | 3 Comments
  • RIO

    "Reshaping" of Rio Tinto merits an upgrade at Morgan Stanley

    • Rio Tinto (RIO +1.7%) opens with solid gains after Morgan Stanley upgrades shares to Overweight from Equal Weight and raises its price target to 4,000p from 3,540p.
    • "The reshaping of RT on its pre-supercycle principles and standards combined with rapidly rising cash flow should trigger a genuine re-rating," says analyst Menno Sanderse, who sees a 34%-41% dividend increase by 2016.
    • Looking to Rio's investment opportunities, the firm thinks there is room for $2B EBITDA improvement in aluminum.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:39 AM
  • SAR

    Saratoga Investment to start paying dividends quarterly; launches buyback

    • Previously making annual payouts, Saratoga Investment (NYSE:SAR) will now pay dividends quarterly, with the first being $0.18 per share for the quarter ended in August, and the second being $0.22 per share for the quarter ending in November. The most recent annual payout was $2.65 in November of last year.
    • The company expects to continue boosting the dividend in coming quarters.
    • A buyback program allowing the company to buy up to 200K shares at prices below net asset value is approved. The current float is about 5.4M shares.
    • SharesÂ +2.6%Â premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM
  • ICLD

    InterCloud +10.9% after announcing backlog growth

    • InterCloud's (NASDAQ:ICLD) 2014 new business backlog is now above $26.4M. That up from $25M+ in early August.
    • Over $10M of the backlog is related to professional services deals, and over $6.5M is related to cloud/managed services deals.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:20 AM

  • Premarket Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: LPCN +46%. OTC:RITT +22%. MACK +16%. GDOT +13%. ICLD +11%. ACOR +10%. SINO +8%. INO +9%. STRZA +7%. NXTD +6%. BBBY +6%. ALCS +6%.
    • Losers: OTC:ECTE -74%. ATOS -49%. BIOF -26%. GTI -19%. KBH -7%. LAND -6%.

  • GDOT

    Green Dot and Wal-Mart to go after the unbanked

    • Green Dot (NYSE:GDOT) announces the national introduction of its GoBank checking account product at Wal-Mart (NYSE:WMT) stores.
    • The checking account will feature no fees for overdrafts and no minimum account balance requirements. A monthly direct deposit of at least $500 a month is needed to avoid a $8.95 per month service charge.
    • The requirements to open a GoBank account are expected to be less stringent than typical banking requirements which could open the door for the estimated 10M households in the U.S. without a banking account.
    • Funds will be held through the FDIC-insured Green Dot Bank.
    • GDOT +15.1% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 9:03 AM | 6 Comments
  • KBH

    More on KB Home's FQ3 results

    • Net income of $28.4M, or $0.28 per diluted share vs. $27.3M, or $0.30 per diluted share in the third quarter of 2013.
    • Deliveries of 1,793 homes vs. 1,825 a year ago. Overall average selling price rose 9%.
    • Total net order value climbed 19% to $629.2M, up from $528.9M in the year-earlier quarter.
    • Backlog of 3,432 homes up 13% Y/Y. Backlog value of $1.1B up 37%.
    • FQ3 results
    • KBH -6.5% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 9:01 AM
  • ACOR

    Investors like Acorda's move for Civitas

    • Acorda Therapeutics (NASDAQ:ACOR) is upÂ 10%Â premarket on robust volume in response to its acquisition of Civitas Therapeutics.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:51 AM
  • LPCN

    Lipocine up big premarket

    • Thinly-traded nano cap Lipocine (NASDAQ:LPCN) is upÂ 27%Â premarket on healthy volume in response to its report of positive top-line results in a Phase 3 trial evaluating LPCN 1021 (testosterone undecanoate) for hypogonadism.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:46 AM
  • MACK

    Merrimack up premarket

    • Merrimack Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:MACK) is upÂ 20%Â premarket on robust volume in response to its collaboration with Baxter.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:41 AM
  • AWAY

    SunTrust initiation lights a torch under HomeAway

    • SunTrust initiates coverage on HomeAway (NASDAQ:AWAY) with a Buy rating on what it calls "compelling" valuation.
    • The investment firm has a $40 price target on shares.
    • AWAY +6.4% premarket to $35.25.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:47 AM

  • China likely to further lower growth target says Goldman

    • Andrew Tilton and team expect Beijing to cut its GDP growth target to 7% in 2015 from 7.5% this year, "in order to limit further accumulation of financial risks and reduce pressure for policy stimulus."
    • There are three factors that contribute to economic growth, says Goldman, and all three - labor growth, capital growth, and technological advance - have their speediest gains behind them.
    • Goldman also cuts its outlook for Hong Kong, now expecting 2.9% GDP growth in 2015 vs. an earlier forecast of 4.4%.
    • ShanghaiÂ climbed 1.5%Â overnight, while the Hang SengÂ fell 0.4%. FXIÂ +1.5%Â Â remarket
    • ETFs: FXI, EWH, PGJ, GXC, YINN, FXP, ASHR, YANG, MCHI, PEK, XPP, YAO, YXI, CHXF, CN, EWHS, FCHI, FCA, CHNA, KBA, FHK
     
     
     
     
    | 7:22 AM | 1 Comment
  • STRZA

    Starz pops on report of sale interest

    • Shares of Starz (NASDAQ:STRZA) soar in early action after a report indicates the company is looking to sell itself.
    • A spokesperson for Starz declined to give an official statement on the speculation.
    • STRZA +10.6% premarket to $32.70.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:15 AM
  • ALCS

    Michael Price exits investment in Alco Stores

    • A favorite of deep value investors for some time, Alco Stores (NASDAQ:ALCS)Â plunged 49.15%Â yesterday to $2.98 following an ugly earnings report, and as Michael Price disclosed he's exited his stake in the company.
    • The company last October rejected a $14 per share buyout offer.
    • The stock'sÂ higher by 1.7%Â in premarket action.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:05 AM | 1 Comment
  • ANF

    Cowen Research warns on Abercrombie & Fitch

    • Cowen Research warns that Abercrombie & Fitch (NYSE:ANF) could be pressured by promotions in denim and currency swings.
    • The analyst notes the Euro accounts for 40% of operating profit.
    • ANF -1.0% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 6:49 AM
  • UL

    Unilever downgraded by Jefferies

    • Jefferies downgrades Unilever (NYSE:UL) to an Underperform rating from Hold.
    • The investment firm thinks valuation is tapped out on Unilever and notes that succession is an issue which is hovering into view.
    • UL -0.5% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 6:44 AM
